raw_comment: I notice that the students in the top 10% parents income are more likely to get accepted into colleges. I wonder if legacy students still get an advantage even if they were to have a low GPA. This relates to my community by lot of people going to similar elite schools and gravitating towards those places. One headline that captures the graphs main idea could be "Students Acceptance Advantages Into Colleges With Parents That Have a Higher Income Rate".
ace_sentences: I notice that students in the top 10% of parent income are more likely to be accepted into colleges.
I wonder whether legacy students still have an advantage.
I wonder whether a legacy student has an advantage even if the legacy student has a low GPA.
Many people in my community go to similar elite schools.
Many people in my community gravitate toward these elite schools.
The headline is: Students Acceptance Advantages Into Colleges With Parents That Have a Higher Income Rate.
